peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify vintage brass?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
One of the simplest ways to determine the authenticity of a brass-looking piece is by using a magnet. “Brass is not magnetic, so if the magnet sticks, it's most likely steel,” says designer Maria Vassiliou of Maria Zoe Designs. If a magnet doesn't stick to your find, then there's a good chance it's genuine brass.
Mar 7, 2024
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Identify Real Brass at the Thrift Store - Apartment Therapy

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify original brass?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
Scratch an inconspicuous area of the item with a sharp tool. Real brass will reveal a similar yellow tone underneath, while brass plating will show a silver, or sometimes copper base metal. Brass produces a pleasant ringing sound when knocked with a hard object.
Jun 6, 2024
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Identify if Brass Is Real - Elesi Blog

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the difference between old brass and antique brass?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: In both cases 'solid brass' means only brass is used in the manufacturing process. Antique brass is a finish applied to the brass. There are a number of ways of doing this, but it usually involves a process of aging or antiquing the surface of the plate. The plates are then finished with lacquer for a robust finish.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What is the Difference Between Antique Brass and Solid Brass
